                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                    <items id="text">BurgerlijkeStaat-v3.0(2017NL)</items>
                    <items id="description">Group of individuals connected by social interactions and personal relationships.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                    <items id="text">BurgerlijkeStaat</items>
                    <items id="description">Single word or phrase that describes an individual's current relationship with a life partner.</items>
                    <items id="comment">Coding of the partnership status with a terminology is preferred, where possible. There is a huge variation in the value sets used across jurisdictions. Many have local, government-mandated value sets rather than using SNOMED CT or similar. For example: a 'marital status' value set including 'never married' or 'single'; 'married'; 'divorced'; or 'widowed'. Also known as 'civil status', 'union status', or 'relationship status'.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                    <items id="text">Last updated</items>
                    <items id="description">Date when the social network was updated.</items>
                    <items id="comment">At implementation, it is assumed that if an associated person or organisation archetype is added or updated then this date will also be updated.
</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                    <items id="text">Extension</items>
                    <items id="description">Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.</items>
                    <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the social network and connections for the individual.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                    <items id="text">Network</items>
                    <items id="description">Structured details about people or community organisations who are connected to the individual.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                    <items id="text">Additional details</items>
                    <items id="description">Additional structured details about the social network.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the social network, not captured in other fields.</items>
                </term_definitions>
            </children>
            <cardinality>
                <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                <is_unique>false</is_unique>
                <interval>
                    <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                    <upper_included>false</upper_included>
                    <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                    <lower>1</lower>
                </interval>
            </cardinality>
        </attributes>
        <archetype_id>
            <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.social_summary.v0</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <template_id>
            <value>DataHub-BurgerlijkeStaat-2017-terminology</value>
        </template_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
            <items id="text">DataHub-BurgerlijkeStaat-2017</items>
            <items id="description">A persistent and evolving summary record of information about social circumstances and experiences that may impact an individual's health.</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
            <items id="text">Social summary</items>
            <items id="description">Summary information about social circumstances or experiences that may have a potential impact on an individual's health.</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
            <items id="text">Tree</items>
            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
            <items id="text">Items</items>
            <items id="description">Additional COMPOSITION related data.</items>
        </term_definitions>
    </definition>
</template>
